alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nicholas, southwestern Webster and Fayette Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Summersville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Ansted, Camden-On-gauley, Craigsville, Hawks Nest State Park, Camden On Gauley, Meadow Bridge, Thurmond, Canvas, Muddlety, Nettie, Calvin, Kesslers Cross Lanes and Mount Nebo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia near mile marker 137. Route 19 between mile markers 7 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster
